title: Mount Smith
text: Mount Smith () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> over 1,400 m, standing north of <a href="Mawson%20Glacier">Mawson Glacier</a> and 7 miles (11 km) north-northwest of <a href="Mount%20Murray%20%28Antarctica%29">Mount Murray</a> in the <a href="Prince%20Albert%20Mountains">Prince Albert Mountains</a> in <a href="Victoria%20Land">Victoria Land, Antarctica</a>. Discovered by the <a href="Discovery%20Expedition">Discovery Expedition</a> (1901–04), which probably named this peak for W. E. Smith, Chief Naval Constructor, who prepared the plans and supervised construction of the expedition ship <a href="RRS%20Discovery">RRS "Discovery"</a>.
